selected_quotes: Las células del cáncer durmientes pueden activarse décadas más tarde
Protracted dormancy of pre-leukaemic stem cells CancerCureNow -
Protracted dormancy of pre-leukaemic stem cells (Greaves lab) #cancerSC

citation.abstract: Cancer stem cells can escape therapeutic kill by adopting a quiescent or dormant state. The reversibility of this condition provides the potential for later recurrence or relapse, potentially many years later. We describe the genomics of a rare case of childhood BCR-ABL1 positive, B cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukaemia (ALL) that relapsed, with an AML immunophenotype, 22 years after the initial diagnosis, sustained remission and presumed cure. The primary and relapsed leukaemias shared the identical BCR-ABL1 fusion genomic sequence and two identical immunoglobulin gene rearrangements, indicating that the relapse was derivative of the founding clone. All other mutational changes (SNV, CNAs) were distinct in diagnostic or relapse samples. These data provide unambiguous evidence that leukaemia-propagating cells, most probably pre-leukaemic stem cells, can remain covert and silent but potentially reactivatable for more than two decades.Leukemia accepted article preview online, 28 May 2015. doi:10.1038/leu.2015.132.
citation.title: Protracted dormancy of pre-leukemic stem cells

news.title: ‘Sleeping’ cancer cells can cause relapse 20 years later
news.summary: “Sleeping” cancer cells can wake up more than 20 years after a patient appears to have been cured and bring...

news.title: Late cancer relapse driven by 'reawakening of sleeping cancer cells'
news.summary: Cancer cells can avoid chemotherapy by going to sleep, laying dormant for years before they reawaken decades later, according to a new study by UK researchers.

facebook.title: Sleeping cancer cells can ‘wake up’ after decades

facebook.title: Sleeping cancer cells can 'wake up' decades later - BBC News
facebook.summary: A study published in the journal Leukemia finds that cancer stem cells can escape the effects of chemotherapy by adopting a quiescent or dormant state. The authors state that pre-leukaemic stem cells can remain covert and silent but potentially reactivatab

blogs.title: Sleeping cancer cells can ‘wake up’ after decades
blogs.summary: Scientists at the ICR have found genetic evidence that cancer cells can go to sleep – avoiding the effects of treatment – only to ‘wake up’ many years later.

author.name: Institute of Cancer Research
author.description: The Institute of Cancer Research is one of the world’s leading cancer research organisations and cancer charities. In partnership with The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trust, The ICR specialises in cancer diagnosis, cancer treatment and cancer education
